alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 12:10PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Republic affecting Marquette County. .Recent rainfall and snowmelt has resulted in high river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Republic. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.7 feet, Water begins to impact the yards of homes near Bengtson bridge on County Road LI in South Republic * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:41 AM EDT Monday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:41 AM EDT Monday was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report observed flooding to the National Weather Service in Marquette and local emergency services when you can do so safely. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 200 AM EDT.
